thread.title: Northwestern boosts NCAA tournament case with upset of No. 5 Wisconsin
thread.title_full: Northwestern boosts NCAA tournament case with upset of No. 5 Wisconsin

author: USA TODAY
title: Northwestern boosts NCAA tournament case with upset of No. 5 Wisconsin
text:
Northwestern boosts NCAA tournament case with upset of No. 5 Wisconsin Wisconsin's loss did not do the Big Ten any favors when it comes to NCAA tournament seeding. Post to Facebook Northwestern boosts NCAA tournament case with upset of No. 5 Wisconsin Wisconsin's loss did not do the Big Ten any favors when it comes to NCAA tournament seeding.  //usat.ly/2kAIIsv   Northwestern boosts NCAA tournament case with upset of No. 5 Wisconsin USA TODAY 8:28 p.m. ET Feb. 12, 2017 Northwestern Wildcats guard Isiah Brown (12) attempts a basket as Wisconsin Badgers guard Bronson Koenig (24) defends at the Kohl Center. (Photo: Mary Langenfeld, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Northwestern earned a crucial Big Ten road win by upsetting No. 5-ranked Wisconsin, 66-59, on Sunday. 
In doing so, Northwestern (19-6 overall and 8-4 in the Big Ten) boosted its case to make the school's first-ever appearance in the NCAA tournament. 
The Badgers had won 20 consecutive games at the Kohl Center in Madison. Wisconsin's last home loss came against Maryland on Jan. 9, 2016. 
Wisconsin's loss did not do the Big Ten any favors when it comes to NCAA tournament seeding, as the conference did not have any teams among the top 16 seeds that were unveiled Saturday afternoon..

Gonzaga Bulldogs center Przemek Karnowski (24) attempts to defend against St. Mary's Gaels center Jock Landale (34) during the second half of the game at McKeon Pavilion. The Gonzaga Bulldogs defeated the St. Mary's Gaels with a score of 74-64.
